declarations.comments: Effect type for file system usage.
declarations.title: FS

declarations.comments:
Convert a `FileFlags` to a `String` in the format expected by the Node.js
filesystem API.
declarations.title: fileFlagsToNode

declarations.comments: Symlink varieties.
declarations.title: SymlinkType

declarations.comments:
Convert a `SymlinkType` to a `String` in the format expected by the
Node.js filesystem API.
declarations.title: symlinkTypeToNode

declarations.comments: Type synonym for callback functions.
declarations.title: Callback

declarations.comments: Renames a file.

declarations.comments: Changes the ownership of a file.
declarations.title: chown

declarations.comments: Changes the permissions of a file.
declarations.title: chmod

declarations.comments: Gets file statistics.
declarations.title: stat

declarations.comments: Creates a link to an existing file.
declarations.title: link

declarations.comments: Creates a symlink.

declarations.comments: Reads the value of a symlink.
declarations.title: readlink

declarations.comments: Find the canonicalized absolute location for a path.
declarations.title: realpath

declarations.comments:
Find the canonicalized absolute location for a path using a cache object
for already resolved paths.
declarations.title: realpath'

declarations.comments: Deletes a file.
declarations.title: unlink

declarations.comments: Deletes a directory.
declarations.title: rmdir

declarations.comments: Makes a new directory.
declarations.title: mkdir

declarations.comments: Makes a new directory with the specified permissions.
declarations.title: mkdir'

declarations.comments: Reads the contents of a directory.
declarations.title: readdir

declarations.comments: Sets the accessed and modified times for the specified file.
declarations.title: utimes

declarations.comments: Reads the entire contents of a file returning the result as a raw buffer.
declarations.title: readFile

declarations.comments: Reads the entire contents of a text file with the specified encoding.
declarations.title: readTextFile

declarations.comments: Writes a buffer to a file.
declarations.title: writeFile

declarations.comments: Writes text to a file using the specified encoding.
declarations.title: writeTextFile

declarations.comments: Appends the contents of a buffer to a file.
declarations.title: appendFile

declarations.comments: Appends text to a file using the specified encoding.
declarations.title: appendTextFile

declarations.comments: Check if the path exists.
declarations.title: exists

declarations.comments:
Open a file asynchronously. See the [Node Documentation](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_fs_open_path_flags_mode_callback)
for details.
declarations.title: fdOpen

declarations.comments:
Read from a file asynchronously. See the [Node Documentation](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_fs_read_fd_buffer_offset_length_position_callback)
for details.
declarations.title: fdRead

declarations.comments:
Convenience function to fill the whole buffer from the current
file position.
declarations.title: fdNext

declarations.comments:
Write to a file asynchronously. See the [Node Documentation](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_fs_write_fd_buffer_offset_length_position_callback)
for details.
declarations.title: fdWrite

declarations.comments:
Convenience function to append the whole buffer to the current
file position.
declarations.title: fdAppend

declarations.comments:
Close a file asynchronously. See the [Node Documentation](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html#fs_fs_close_fd_callback)
for details.
declarations.title: fdClose

declarations.comments:
A `Perm` value specifies what is allowed to be done with a particular
file by a particular class of user — that is, whether it is
readable, writable, and/or executable. It has a `Semiring` instance, which
allows you to combine permissions:

- `(+)` adds `Perm` values together. For example, `read + write` means
  "readable and writable".
- `(*)` masks permissions. It can be thought of as selecting only the
   permissions that two `Perm` values have in common. For example:
   `(read + write) * (write + execute) == write`.

You can think also of a `Perm` value as a subset of the set
`{ read, write, execute }`; then, `(+)` and `(*)` represent set union and
intersection respectively.
declarations.title: Perm

declarations.comments:
No permissions. This is the identity of the `Semiring` operation `(+)`
for `Perm`; that is, it is the same as `zero`.
declarations.title: none

declarations.comments: The "readable" permission.
declarations.title: read

declarations.comments: The "writable" permission.
declarations.title: write

declarations.comments: The "executable" permission.
declarations.title: execute

declarations.comments:
All permissions: readable, writable, and executable. This is the identity
of the `Semiring` operation `(*)` for `Perm`; that is, it is the same as
`one`.
declarations.title: all

declarations.comments:
A `Perms` value includes all the permissions information about a
particular file or directory, by storing a `Perm` value for each of the
file owner, the group, and any other users.
declarations.title: Perms

declarations.comments:
Attempt to parse a `Perms` value from a `String` containing an octal
integer. For example,
`permsFromString "0644" == Just (mkPerms (read + write) read read)`.
declarations.title: permsFromString

declarations.comments:
Create a `Perms` value. The arguments represent the owner's, group's, and
other users' permission sets, respectively.
declarations.title: mkPerms

declarations.comments:
Convert a `Perms` value to an octal string, in a format similar to that
accepted by `chmod`. For example:
`permsToString (mkPerms (read + write) read read) == "0644"`
declarations.title: permsToString

declarations.comments: Convert a `Perms` value to an `Int`, via `permsToString`.
declarations.title: permsToInt

declarations.comments: Stats wrapper to provide a usable interface to the underlying properties and methods.
declarations.title: Stats

declarations.comments:
Create a Writable stream which writes data to the specified file, using
the default options.
declarations.title: createWriteStream

declarations.comments:
Create a Writable stream which writes data to the specified file
descriptor, using the default options.
declarations.title: fdCreateWriteStream

declarations.comments: Like `createWriteStream`, but allows you to pass options.
declarations.title: createWriteStreamWith

declarations.comments: Like `fdCreateWriteStream`, but allows you to pass options.
declarations.title: fdCreateWriteStreamWith

declarations.comments:
Create a Readable stream which reads data to the specified file, using
the default options.
declarations.title: createReadStream

declarations.comments:
Create a Readable stream which reads data to the specified file
descriptor, using the default options.
declarations.title: fdCreateReadStream

declarations.comments: Create a Readable stream which reads data from the specified file.
declarations.title: createReadStreamWith

declarations.comments: Create a Readable stream which reads data from the specified file descriptor.
declarations.title: fdCreateReadStreamWith
